Bomb]] |publisher=CBS Interactive |accessdate=June 13, 2018}} | GB_X360 = {{Rating|5|5}} | IGN_PS3 = 8/10{{cite web |last=Brudvig |first=Erik |date=March 20, 2008 |url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2008/03/21/condemned-2-bloodshot-review |title=Condemned 2: Bloodshot Review (PS3) |website=IGN |publisher=Ziff Davis |accessdate=June 13, 2018}} | IGN_X360 = (AU) 8.4/10{{cite web |last=Kolan |first=Patrick |date=March 27, 2008 |url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2008/03/28/condemned-2-au-review |title=Condemned 2 AU Review (X360) |website=IGN |publisher=Ziff Davis |accessdate=June 13, 2018}}
(US) 8/10{{cite web |last=Brudvig |first=Erik |date=March 11, 2008 |url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2008/03/11/condemned-2-bloodshot-review-2 |title=Condemned 2: Bloodshot Review (X360) |website=IGN |publisher=Ziff Davis |accessdate=June 13, 2018}} | OXM_X360 = 8/10{{cite magazine |last=Amrich |first=Dan |url=http://www.oxmonline.com/article/reviews/xbox-360/a-f/condemned-2-bloodshot |title=Condemned 2: Bloodshot |magazine=[[Official Xbox Magazine]] |publisher=[[Future US]] |date=April 2008 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080313185319/http://www.oxmonline.com/article/reviews/xbox-360/a-f/condemned-2-bloodshot |archivedate=March 13, 2008 |deadurl=yes |accessdate=June 13, 2018}} | PSM_PS3 = {{Rating|4|5}}{{cite magazine |title=Review: Condemned 2: Bloodshot |magazine=[[PlayStation: The Official Magazine]] |publisher=Future plc |issue=8 |date=July 2008 |page=80}} | rev1 = ''[[The A.V. Club]]'' | rev1_X360 = B−{{cite web |last=Dahlen |first=Chris |date=March 26, 2008 |url=https://games.avclub.com/condemned-2-bloodshot-1798213570 |title=Condemned 2: Bloodshot (X360) |website=[[The A.V. Club]] |publisher=[[The Onion]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100315225251/http://www.avclub.com/articles/condemned-2-bloodshot,7182/ |archivedate=March 15, 2010 |deadurl=no |accessdate=June 13, 2018}} | rev2 = ''[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]'' | rev2_PS3 = {{Rating|8|10}}{{cite web |last=Arendt |first=Susan |date=March 31, 2008 |url=https://www.wired.com/2008/03/condemned-2-rev/ |title=Review: Condemned 2 Favors Action Over Atmosphere |website=[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]] |publisher=[[Condé Nast]] |accessdate=June 13, 2018}} | rev2_X360 = {{Rating|8|10}} | MC_PS3 = 82/100{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/playstation-3/condemned-2-bloodshot |title=Condemned 2: Bloodshot for PlayStation 3 Reviews |website=[[Metacritic]] |publisher=CBS Interactive |accessdate=July 22, 2011}} | MC_X360 = 80/100{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/xbox-360/condemned-2-bloodshot |title=Condemned 2: Bloodshot for Xbox 360 Reviews |website=Metacritic |publisher=CBS Interactive |accessdate=July 22, 2011}} }} ''Condemned 2: Bloodshot'' received "favorable" reviews on both platforms according to the [[Review aggregator|review aggregation]] website [[Metacritic]]. ''[[Official Xbox Magazine]]'' praised the areas of atmosphere, graphics and sound for the game, and found it to be improved in almost all aspects over the original. The review did, however, find the ending to be weak and one of its major downsides. The three reviewers in ''[[Electronic Gaming Monthly]]'' praised the Xbox 360 version's atmosphere and improved combat system, but were not satisfied with the "laggy, unnecessary feel" of the game's multiplayer component.{{cite magazine |author=EGM staff |title=Condemned 2: Bloodshot |magazine=[[Electronic Gaming Monthly]] |publisher=Ziff Davis |issue=227 |date=April 2008 |page=74}} ''[[Edge (magazine)|Edge]]'' said that the same console version had lost the first game's tight storyline in favor of a deranged psychotic bloodbath, in which guns and gore "occur anywhere and everywhere to ever-decreasing effect" and had taken precedence over the tension and fear factors which the magazine had enjoyed in the previous title. In a caption the review expressed surprise that "you can [...] make enemy heads explode by shouting at them" and noted that they did not expect that "the [[ABC Warriors]] would appear in the game's final act, and that you'd take them down with a sonic crossbow and giant magnet." 411Mania gave the Xbox 360 version an 8.7 out of 10 and said it was "a game that encourages you to think outside the box and use some strategy and smarts while challenging you to stay alive in hopes of bringing your city back to sanity."{{cite web |last=Aranda |first=Ramon |date=April 4, 2008 |url=http://www.411mania.com/games/reviews/72433 |title=Condemned 2: Bloodshot (Xbox 360) Review |website=411Mania |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080406130519/http://www.411mania.com/games/reviews/72433 |archivedate=April 6, 2008 |deadurl=yes |accessdate=June 13, 2018}} ''[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]'' gave the game a score of eight stars out of ten and said that it "has plenty of creepy moments, but it favors action over atmosphere. To that end it performs very well, and even throws in some juicy plot twists and a cliffhanger ending. But I miss the tension of the original, just the same." ''[[The A.V. Club]]'' gave the Xbox 360 version a B− and called it "A series of amazing shocks that are never quite worthy of suspension of disbelief." {{clear}} ==Future== Rumors about a sequel have circulated since ''Condemned 2''{{'}}s release; however, it had been doubtful that a ''Condemned 3'' would ever occur. One of the Condemned series' previous developers stated in an interview with video game website [[NeoGAF]], "Sadly it will never happen. ''Condemned 2'' just didn't sell enough copies. It is sad that ''Condemned 2'' got caught up in the 'everything needs multiplayer'. We could have really used the staff on multiplayer to make the single player campaign amazing. There was some good ideas of where to take the game. I've always wanted to do a reboot and just play ''Condemned 2'' off as a bad hangover and have Thomas closer to what he was in [''Condemned: Criminal Origins'']."{{cite web |url=https://www.neogaf.com/threads/lttp-condemned-criminal-origins-spoilers.454223/#post-36410544 |title=LTTP: Condemned: Criminal Origins (spoilers) |website=[[NeoGAF]] |date=March 27, 2012 |accessdate=June 13, 2018}} Monolith co-founder and former CEO [[Jace Hall]] currently holds the rights to the ''Condemned'' series and on January 31, 2015, he expressed his interest on [[Facebook]] to find the right indie development team to "take over the franchise and move it forward."{{cite web |last=Hall |first=Jace |date=January 31, 2015 |url=https://www.facebook.com/JaceHallShow/posts/10152999663109303 |title=Deep thought..and question... |website=[[Facebook]] |accessdate=February 1, 2015}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{moby game|id=/condemned-2-bloodshot}} {{Monolith games}} [[Category:2008 video games]] [[Category:Detective video games]] [[Category:Lithtech engine games]] [[Category:Monolith Productions games]] [[Category:Multiplayer and single-player video games]] [[Category:PlayStation 3 games]] [[Category:Psychological horror games]] [[Category:Occult detective fiction]] [[Category:Sega video games]] [[Category:Censored video games]] [[Category:Video game sequels]] [[Category:Video games developed in the United States]] [[Category:Xbox 360 games]]

'''Claud Dennis McKinsey''' (March 5, 1940 – June 23, 2009 in [[Ohio]])<ref>[http://www.legacy.com/obituaries/dispatch/obituary.aspx?n=claud-dennis-mckinsey&pid=128922877 Obituary - Claud Dennis McKinsey]</ref> was an [[United States|American]] [[atheist]] and author of works on the subject of [[Biblical inerrancy]] from a critical perspective.
==Biography== McKinsey obtained a [[bachelor's degree]] in [[philosophy]] in 1962 and a [[master's degree]] in the [[social sciences]] in 1964 from the [[University of Indiana]]. He taught social studies full-time at the secondary level for ten years. He was a community college instructor in sociology and a secondary guidance counselor for the [[London City School District]]. For brief periods he was a civil rights investigator, a truant officer, and a government researcher.
McKinsey was highly skeptical of claims from the [[Bible]] which he believed contained many errors, contradictions, and fallacies.<ref>[https://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/books/229598/the-encyclopedia-of-biblical-errancy-by-c-dennis-mckinsey/9780879759261/ "The Encyclopedia of Biblical Errancy"]. Retrieved 22 October 2017.</ref> He authored ''The Encyclopedia of Biblical Errancy'' (1995) and ''Biblical Errancy: A Reference Guide'' (2000). He also wrote and published a monthly periodical known as ''Biblical Errancy'' from 1982 to 1999.<ref>[http://www.freethoughtassociation.org/eNews/200611/meeting-biblefallacies.html "Don’t Miss “Errors, Contradictions and Fallacies in the Bible”"]. Freethought Association of West Michigan. Retrieved 22 October 2017.</ref>
He was an advocate of the [[Christ myth theory]]. McKinsey wrote that "Jesus is a mythical figure in the tradition of pagan mythology and almost nothing in all of ancient literature would lead one to believe otherwise. Anyone wanting to believe Jesus lived and walked as a real live human being must do so despite the evidence, not because of it."<ref>McKinsey, Dennis. (1995). ''The Encyclopedia of Biblical Errancy''. Prometheus Books. p. 108</ref>
==Politics==
McKinsey identified as a [[Marxism–Leninism|Marxist-Leninist]]. He authored the book ''The Relevance of Marxism'' (1994).<ref>https://books.google.ca/books/about/The_Relevance_of_Marxism.html?id=xQKjGwAACAAJ&redir_esc=y</ref>
==Publications==
*''The Relevance of Marxism'' (1994) *''The Encyclopedia of Biblical Errancy'' ([[Prometheus Books]], 1995) *''Biblical Errancy: A Reference Guide'' ([[Prometheus Books]], 2000)
==References== {{reflist}}

'''Devarattam''' ("dance of the gods") is the dance of the gods,who were called as Devargal in hindu mythology. The dance involves fast and fluent movements to the rhythmic sound of ''Deva Thunthubi'' ([[Urumi (drum)]]), an hour-glass shaped drum that is struck on one side and rubbed on the other side with a curved stick.
Today, the dance is performed during festivals, marriages and other social occasions.{{cn|date=February 2012}} but traditionally, this Devarattam is danced by the one of the sub group of peoples belongs to the Mukkulathor community, who are also collectively known as Thevar or Devar during their king returned with his army after a successful battle in war particularly between Chola and Pandyan dynasty in south india .<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.india9.com/i9show/Devarattam-26478.htm |title=Devarattam in Madurai India |publisher=India9.com |date=2005-06-07 |accessdate=2012-02-10}}</ref>
== References == <references/>
==External links == *[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OF01wF2vaO4 Video on YouTube]
[[Category:Tamil dance styles]] [[Category:Hindu art]]

'''Esege Malan''' ({{lang-mn|Эсеге Малан}}, {{lang-bua|Эсэгэ}}, {{lang-ru|Эсэгэ Малан}}), according to [[Mongol]] [[Mythology|myth]] and the belief of the [[Buryats]], is the great [[Creator deity|Creator]] of all living things. He is a Buryat sky-god who rules over the western [[horizon]]. His son is [[Solobung Yubin]], a spiritual morning [[star]] which, if offered sacrifices, will reward the [[Mongol]] people with greater harvest yields and prosperity.
As chief of the sky-spirits, Esege Malaan calls meetings of them "in the [[Pleiadeans|Pleiades]] and on the moon".<ref>[http://www.newdawnbooks.info/Reviews/CHOSEN_BY_THE_SPIRITS.html Sarangerel (Julie Ann Stewart), Chosen by the Spirits : Following Your Shamanic Calling.]</ref> Esege is a bald god.<ref>Türk Söylence Sözlüğü (Turkish Mythological Dictionary), Deniz Karakurt, [[:tr:Türk Söylence Sözlüğü|(OTRS: CC BY-SA 3.0)]]</ref>
==Creation of Earth==
In the beginning of Universe there were only Esege Malan, the highest god. Everywhere was dark and silent. There was nothing to be seen. Esege took up a handful of earth and made the sun and moon. Then he made all plants. Esege divided the earth into East and West. Gave it to the highest order of gods.
==Esege and Mother Earth==
After all things Mother Earth, went to visit him. They spent several days. When she was ready to go, she asked to give her the sun and the moon. But he soon found that it was very difficult to get them for her. Then Esege Malan sent for the hedgehog ''Esh''. It went up to the Tenger (sky) to the dwelling of Esege Malan.
==External links== *[http://www.sacred-texts.com/asia/jss/jss29.htm Sacred texts] *[http://levigilant.com/Bulfinch_Mythology/bulfinch.englishatheist.org/russia/part2.htm Myths Connected With Mongol Religion]
==References== {{reflist}}

{{infobox UK place| |country = England |coordinates = {{coord|51.1989|-0.4855|display=inline,title}} |official_name= Farley Green |map_type= Surrey |population = |civil_parish= [[Albury, Surrey|Albury]] |shire_district= [[Borough of Guildford|Guildford]] | shire_county = [[Surrey]] |region= South East England |constituency_westminster= [[Mole Valley]] |post_town= |postcode_district = GU5 |postcode_area= GU |dial_code= 01483 |os_grid_reference= TQ059454 |static_image_name=Farley green.jpg |static_image_caption=Farley Green, [[Surrey]]. }} '''Farley Green''' is a small hamlet of [[Albury, Surrey|Albury]] in the [[Greensand Ridge]] where it forms the south of the [[Surrey Hills AONB]], to the south east of [[Guildford]].
==History== On the outskirts of Farley Green, lies Farley Heath where one of Surrey's few Roman remains, a temple, can be found. The open heathland was the site of the largest [[Romano-British]] settlement in [[Surrey]].
The site was excavated by [[Martin Tupper]], an antiquarian and poet, who lived in nearby [[Albury, Surrey|Albury]]. Some of his finds are now housed in the [[British Museum]]. A [[Romano-Celtic Temple]] was in use some time before the end of the 1st century AD and was believed to be destroyed by fire around 450 AD.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.pastscape.org.uk/hob.aspx?hob_id=393929 |title=PastScape Entry for Farley Roman Temple |publisher=English Heritage |year=2007 |accessdate=2013-11-24}}</ref> The outline of the temple can still be seen and is marked out by stones set in concrete.
==Topography== The village houses spread mostly along Shophouse Lane which then becomes steep and narrow towards [[Winterfold Forest]] which ascends to more than 200 metres [[Above Ordnance Datum]]. The forest which climbs right to the summit of the Greensand Ridge is part of the [[Peaslake#Hurtwood|Hurtwood]] and is where some of the [[Great Train Robbery (1963)|Great Train Robbery]] proceeds were discovered, buried. The whole undulating area covering the south of Albury parish had been the haunt of smugglers in the distant past.<ref>[http://www.thegoodmoveguide.com/Locations/Surrey/Boroughs/Guildford/Guides/villages/farleygreen.htm The Good Move guide] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070929221659/http://www.thegoodmoveguide.com/Locations/Surrey/Boroughs/Guildford/Guides/villages/farleygreen.htm |date=2007-09-29 }}</ref>
The hamlet has its own [[Anglicanism|Anglican]] chapel, dedicated to [[St Michael]], which is in a 19th-century barn built by the Albury Estate. It was later sold and the widow gave the barn to Albury parish.<ref name="VillageChurches">{{cite web |url=http://www.guildford.gov.uk/CHttpHandler.ashx?id=6261&p=0 |title=Village Churches |format=PDF |year=2014 |publisher=Guildford Borough Council |accessdate=23 May 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6O4qy51NN?url=http://www.guildford.gov.uk/CHttpHandler.ashx?id=6261&p=0 |archivedate=14 March 2014 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
Edgeley Caravan Park is located off the main road in landscaped grounds.
==Notable residents== * [[C. J. Allen (sculptor)]]
==References== <references/>
==External links== {{Commons category inline|Farley Green, Surrey}}

{{About|the fictional humanoid type of creature|the garden ornament|Garden gnome|the [[WP:Humor|humorous]] usage on Wikipedia|:Wikipedia:WikiGnome|other uses|Gnome (disambiguation)}} {{pp-pc1}} {{pp-move-indef|small=yes}} {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2018}} {{Infobox mythical creature |name = Gnome |AKA = |image = Heinrich Schlitt Gnom mit Zeitung und Tabakspfeife.jpg |image_size = |caption = ''Gnom mit Zeitung und Tabakspfeife'' (English: ''Gnome with newspaper and tobacco pipe'') by {{Interlanguage link multi|Heinrich Schlitt|de}} (1923) |Mythology = Renaissance |Grouping = Diminutive spirit |Sub_Grouping = |Parents = |Country = |Region = |Habitat = |First_Reported = 16th century |Last_Reported = }} A '''gnome''' {{IPAc-en|n|oʊ|m}}{{Cite OED|Gnome}} is a diminutive spirit in [[Renaissance magic]] and [[alchemy]], first introduced by [[Paracelsus]] in the 16th century and later adopted by more recent authors including those of modern fantasy literature. Its characteristics have been reinterpreted to suit the needs of various story tellers, but it is typically said to be a small [[humanoid]] that lives underground.{{cite web |url=http://www.britannica.com/eb/article-9037122/gnome |title=Gnome |work=Encyclopædia Britannica Online |accessdate=12 March 2008 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080417103944/http://www.britannica.com/eb/article-9037122/gnome |archivedate=17 April 2008 |df=dmy-all}} ==History== ===Origins=== The word comes from [[Renaissance Latin]] ''gnomus'', which first appears in the ''Ex Libro de Nymphis, Sylvanis, Pygmaeis, Salamandris et Gigantibus, etc'' by [[Paracelsus]], published posthumously in [[Nysa, Poland|Nysa]] in 1566 (and again in the Johannes Huser edition of 1589–1591 from an autograph by Paracelsus).{{cite book |title=Ex Libro de Nymphis, Sylvanis, Pygmaeis, Salamandris et Gigantibus, etc |author=[[Paracelsus]] |publisher=Ioannes Cruciger |location=[[Nysa, Poland|Nissae Silesiorum]] |date=1566}} The term may be an original invention of Paracelsus, possibly deriving the term from Latin ''gēnomos'' (itself representing a Greek {{lang|grc|γη-νομος}}, literally "earth-dweller"). In this case, the omission of the ''ē'' is, as the [[Oxford English Dictionary]] (OED) calls it, a blunder. Paracelsus uses ''Gnomi'' as a synonym of ''[[Pygmæi]]'' and classifies them as earth [[elemental]]s. He describes them as two [[span (unit)|spans]] high, very reluctant to interact with humans, and able to move through solid earth as easily as humans move through air.{{cite book |title=The Discarded Image - An Introduction to Medieval and Renaissance Literature |publisher=Cambridge University Press |first=C. S. |last=Lewis |authorlink=C. S. Lewis |page=135 |year=1964 |isbn=0-521-47735-2}} The [[chthonic]], or earth-dwelling, spirit has precedents in numerous ancient and medieval mythologies, often guarding mines and precious underground treasures, notably in the [[Germanic peoples|Germanic]] [[dwarf (mythology)|dwarfs]] and the Greek [[Chalybes]], [[Telchines]] or [[Dactyl (mythology)|Dactyls]]. ===In Romanticism and modern fairy tales=== [[File:CarlSpitzwegGnomEisenbahnbetrachtend.jpg|thumb|upright|''Gnome watching railway train'', [[Carl Spitzweg]], 1848]] The English word is attested from the early 18th century. Gnomes are used in [[Alexander Pope]]'s "[[The Rape of the Lock]]". The creatures from this mock-epic are small, celestial creatures which were prudish women in their past-lives, and now spend all of eternity looking out for prudish women (in parallel to the guardian angels in Catholic belief). Other uses of the term ''gnome'' remain obscure until the early 19th century, when it is taken up by authors of [[Romanticist]] collections of [[fairy tale]]s and becomes mostly synonymous with the older word ''[[goblin]]''. Pope's stated source, the French satire ''[[Comte de Gabalis]]'' (1670), used the term ''gnomide'' to refer to female gnomes (often "gnomid" in English translations).{{cite book |url=http://sacred-texts.com/eso/cdg/index.htm |title=Comte de Gabalis |publisher=The Brothers, Old Bourne Press |location=London |first=N.-P.-H. |last=de Montfaucon de Villars |date=1913 |origyear=1670 |oclc=6624965 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150513012258/http://www.sacred-texts.com/eso/cdg/index.htm |archivedate=13 May 2015 |df=dmy-all}} The author of this work, [[Nicolas-Pierre-Henri de Montfaucon de Villars]], the abbot of Villars, describes gnomes as such:
"The Earth is filled almost to the Center with ''Gnomes'' or ''Pharyes'', a People of small Stature, the Guardians of Treasures, of Mines, and of Precious Stones. They are Ingenious, Friends of Men, and easie to be commandded. They furnish the Children of the ''Sages'' with as much Money, as they have need of; and never ask any other Reward of their Services, than the Glory of being Commanded. The ''Gnomides'' or Wives of these ''Gnomes'' or ''Pharyes'', are Little, but very Handson; and their Habit marvellously Curious."{{cite book |url=http://gateway.proquest.com/openurl?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2003&res_id=xri:eebo&rft_id=xri:eebo:image:199577 |title=The Count of Gabalis: Or, The Extravagant Mysteries of the Cabalists, Exposed in Five Pleasant Discourses on the Secret Sciences |publisher=B. M. Printer |location=London |first=Nicolas-Pierre-Henri |last=Montfaucon de Villars |translator-first=P. A. |translator-last=Gent |pages=29-30 |date=1680 |oclc=992499594}}
In 19th century fiction, the [[chthonic]] gnome became a sort of antithesis to the more airy or luminous [[fairy]]. [[Nathaniel Hawthorne]] in ''[[Twice-Told Tales]]'' (1837) contrasts the two in "Small enough to be king of the fairies, and ugly enough to be king of the gnomes" (cited after [[OED]]). Similarly, gnomes are contrasted to [[elf|elves]], as in [[William Cullen Bryant]]'s ''Little People of the Snow'' (1877), which has "let us have a tale of elves that ride by night, with jingling reins, or gnomes of the mine" (cited after [[OED]]). One of the first movements in [[Modest Mussorgsky|Mussorgsky's]] 1874 work ''[[Pictures at an Exhibition]]'', named "Gnomus" ([[Latin]] for "The Gnome"), is written to sound as if a gnome is moving about, his movements constantly changing in speed.{{listen|type=music|filename=Modest Mussorgsky - pictures at an exhibition - i. gnomus - vivo.ogg|title=Gnomus|description=|format=[[ogg]]|help=no}} [[Franz Hartmann]] in 1895 satirized [[materialism]] in an allegorical tale entitled ''Unter den Gnomen im Untersberg''. The English translation appeared in 1896 as ''Among the Gnomes: An Occult Tale of Adventure in the Untersberg''. In this story, the ''Gnomes'' are still clearly subterranean creatures, guarding treasures of gold within the [[Untersberg]] mountain. As a figure of 19th century [[fairy tale]]s, the term gnome became largely synonymous with other terms for "[[little people (mythology)|little people]]" by the 20th century, such as ''[[goblin]]'', ''[[brownie (folklore)|brownie]]'', ''[[kobold]]'', ''[[leprechaun]]'', ''[[Heinzelmännchen]]'' and other instances of the "[[domestic spirit]]" type, losing its strict association with earth or the underground world. ==Cultural references== ===Modern fantasy literature=== * Creatures called ''gnomes'' have been used in the [[fantasy]] genre of fiction and later gaming since the mid-nineteenth century, typically in a cunning role, e.g. as an inventor.{{cite book |title=[[The Encyclopedia of Fantasy]] |chapter=Elemental |publisher=St. Martin's Griffin |location=New York |first1=John |last1=Clute |first2=John |last2=Grant |pages=313–314 |date=1999 |isbn=0-312-19869-8}} * In [[L. Frank Baum]]'s [[List of Oz books|Oz]] series (created 1900 to 1914), the Nomes (so spelled), especially [[Nome King|their king]], are the chief adversaries of the Oz people. They are ugly, hot-tempered, immortal, round-bodied with spindly legs and arms, have long beards and wild hair, live underground, and are the militant protectors/hoarders of jewels and precious metals. Baum does not depict any female gnomes. [[Ruth Plumly Thompson]], who continued the series (1972 to 1976) after Baum's death, reverted to the traditional spelling. ** L. Frank Baum also featured the classical gnomes in his book ''[[The Life and Adventures of Santa Claus]]''. They are in charge of watching over the rocks and their king is part of the Council of Immortals. In addition, they also created the sleigh bells for [[Santa Claus]]' [[Santa Claus's reindeer|reindeer]]. * [[J. R. R. Tolkien]], in the [[Tolkien's legendarium|legendarium]] (created 1914 to 1973) surrounding his [[Elf (Middle-earth)|Elves]], uses "Gnomes" as the initial and later dropped name of the [[Noldor]], the most gifted and technologically minded of his elvish races, in conscious exploitation of the similarity with the word ''[[:wikt:gnomic|gnomic]]''. ''Gnome'' is thus Tolkien's English loan-translation of the [[Quenya]] word ''Noldo'' (plural ''Noldor''), "those with knowledge". Tolkien's "Gnomes" are generally tall, beautiful, dark-haired, light-skinned, immortal, and typically wise but suffer from pride, tend towards violence, and have an overweening love of the works of their own hands, particularly gemstones. Many of them live in cities below ground ([[Nargothrond]]) or in secluded mountain fortresses ([[Gondolin]]). He uses "Gnomes" to refer to both males and females. In ''[[The Father Christmas Letters]]'' (between 1920 and 1942), which Tolkien wrote for his children, Red Gnomes are presented as helpful creatures who come from Norway to the North Pole to assist Father Christmas and his Elves in fighting the wicked Goblins. * [[Denys Watkins-Pitchford|BB's]] ''[[The Little Grey Men]]'' (1942) is a story of the last gnomes in England, little wild men who live by hunting and fishing. * In [[C. S. Lewis]]'s ''[[The Chronicles of Narnia]]'' (created 1950 to 1956), the gnomes are sometimes called "Earthmen". live in the [[Underland (Narnia)|Underland]], a series of subterranean caverns. Unlike the traditional, more human-like gnomes, they can have a wide variety of physical features and skin colours. They are used as slaves by the [[Lady of the Green Kirtle]]. * The Dutch books ''[[Gnomes (book)|Gnomes]]'' (1976) and ''[[The Secret Book of Gnomes]]'' (1984), written by [[Wil Huygen]], deal with gnomes living together in harmony. These same books are the basis for [[Gnomes (film)|a made-for-TV animated film]] and the Spanish-animated series ''[[The World of David the Gnome]]'' (as well as the spin-off ''[[Wisdom of the Gnomes]]''). The word "gnome", in this case, is used in place of the Dutch [[kabouter]]. * In the ''[[Warcraft]]'' franchise (1994 to present), particularly as featured in the [[MMORPG]] ''[[World of Warcraft]]'', [[Races and factions of Warcraft#Gnomes|gnomes]] are a race of beings separate from but [[Races and factions of Warcraft#The Alliance|allied]] to dwarves and humans, with whom they share the lands of the Eastern Kingdoms. Crafty, intelligent, and smaller than their dwarven brethren, gnomes are one of two races in Azeroth regarded as technologically savvy. It is suggested in lore that the gnomes originally were mechanical creations that at some point became organic lifeforms. In ''World of Warcraft'', gnomes are an exile race, having irradiated their home city of Gnomeregan in an unsuccessful last-ditch effort to drive out marauding foes.{{cite news |url=https://www.engadget.com/2014/04/23/know-your-lore-gnomes-the-inheritors-of-the-future/ |title=Know Your Lore: Gnomes, the inheritors of the future |work=Engadget |last=Rossi |first=Matthew |date=23 April 2014 |accessdate=4 July 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160731185111/https://www.engadget.com/2014/04/23/know-your-lore-gnomes-the-inheritors-of-the-future/ |archivedate=31 July 2016 |deadurl=no |df=dmy-all}} * In [[J. K. Rowling]]'s ''[[Harry Potter]]'' series (created 1997 to 2007), gnomes are pests that inhabit the gardens of witches and wizards. They are small creatures with heads that look like potatoes on small stubby bodies. Gnomes are generally considered harmless but mischievous and may bite with sharp teeth. In the books, it is stated that the Weasleys are lenient to gnomes, and tolerate their presence, preferring to throw them out of the garden rather than more extreme measures. * In [[Terry Brooks]]' ''[[Shannara]]'' series (created 1977 to 2017), gnomes are an offshoot race created after the Great Wars. There are several distinctive classes of gnomes. Gnomes are the smallest race. In ''[[The Sword of Shannara]]'' they are considered to be tribal and warlike, the one race that can be the most easily subverted to an evil cause. This is evidenced by their allegiance to the Warlock Lord in ''The Sword of Shannara'' and to the Mord Wraiths in ''[[The Wishsong of Shannara]]''. ===Music=== *"[[The Laughing Gnome]]" is a song by English musician [[David Bowie]], released as a single in 1967. It became a hit when reissued in 1973, in the wake of Bowie's commercial success. *The 1970 album ''[[All Things Must Pass]]'' by English musician [[George Harrison]] has a cover image of the musician sitting among a group of garden gnomes. *"[[The Gnome]]" is a song by [[Pink Floyd]] on their 1967 album ''[[The Piper at the Gates of Dawn]]''. It is about a gnome named Grimble Gromble. ==Derivative uses== {{More citations needed section|date=November 2018}} ===Garden gnomes=== [[File:Westendgnom.jpg|thumb|Westend-Gnome in [[Hof, Bavaria]]]] [[File:Gartenzwerg.jpg|thumb|The garden gnome has come to be stylised as an elderly man with a full white beard and a pointed hat.]] {{Main|Garden gnome}} After [[World War II]] (with early references, in ironic use, from the late 1930s) the diminutive figurines introduced as lawn ornaments during the 19th century came to be known as garden gnomes. The image of the gnome changed further during the 1960s to 1970s, when the first plastic garden gnomes were manufactured. These gnomes followed the style of the 1937 depiction of the seven dwarves in ''[[Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1937 film)|Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs]]'' by [[The Walt Disney Company|Disney]]. This "[[Disneyfication|Disneyfied]]" image of the gnome was built upon by the illustrated children's book classic ''[[The Secret Book of Gnomes]]'' (1976), in the original Dutch ''Leven en werken van de [[Kabouter]]''. Garden gnomes share a resemblance to the Scandinavian [[nisse (folklore)|tomte and nisse]], and the Swedish term "tomte" can be translated as "gnome" in English. ===Gnome-themed parks=== [[File:Wieliczka-color.jpg|thumb|Gnome garden at the [[Wieliczka Salt Mine]], Poland|alt=]] Several gnome themed entertainment parks exist. Notable ones are: * The Gnome Reserve, at [[West Putford]] near [[Bradworthy]] in [[North Devon]], United Kingdom * Gnomeland, at [[Watermouth Castle]] in [[Berrynarbor]], North Devon, United Kingdom * Gnome Magic Garden, at Colchester, United Kingdom * The Gnome Village, at [[Efteling]] theme park in [[Kaatsheuvel]], Netherlands * Zwergen-Park Trusetal, in [[Trusetal]], Germany ===Garden Gnome Liberationists=== [[Garden gnome liberationists]] such as the Gnome Liberation Front were introduced in France in 1997. They claim that Garden Gnomes deserve the same freedom that any other living creature would have. They are noted to have stolen hundreds of gnomes.{{Cite web |url=http://www.dailycamera.com/news/boulder/ci_27539096/gnome-liberation-movement-strikes-boulder |title=Gnome liberation movement strikes Boulder |website=Dailycamera.com |accessdate=8 December 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151210182856/http://www.dailycamera.com/news/boulder/ci_27539096/gnome-liberation-movement-strikes-boulder |archivedate=10 December 2015 |df=dmy-all}}{{Cite news |url=http://www.cnn.com/2001/WORLD/europe/07/12/gnomes.return/ |title=Gnome freedom group strikes again |work=CNN |date=12 July 2001 |accessdate=8 December 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151023011221/http://www.cnn.com/2001/WORLD/europe/07/12/gnomes.return/ |archivedate=23 October 2015 |df=dmy-all}} ===Gnome parades=== Gnome [[parade]]s are held annually at [[Atlanta]]'s [[Inman Park]] Festival.{{cite news |url=http://eastatlanta.patch.com/articles/creating-a-world-record-one-gnome-at-a-time |title=Creating A World Record, One Gnome At A Time |work=East Atlanta Patch |first=Péralte |last=Paul |date=16 April 2012 |accessdate=22 May 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120924051211/http://eastatlanta.patch.com/articles/creating-a-world-record-one-gnome-at-a-time |archivedate=24 September 2012 |df=dmy-all}} Numerous one-off gnome parades have been held, including in [[Savannah, Georgia]] (April 2012){{cite web |url=http://www.southernmamas.com/2012/best-dressed-gnome-contest-adults-kids-savannah/ |title=Best Dressed Gnome Parade & Contest (adults & kids), Savannah |work=Southern Mamas |year=2012 |accessdate=22 May 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130316133743/http://www.southernmamas.com/2012/best-dressed-gnome-contest-adults-kids-savannah/ |archivedate=16 March 2013 |df=dmy-all}} and [[Cleveland, Ohio]] (May 2011).{{cite news |url=http://www.cleveland.com/parents/index.ssf/2011/05/5_ways_for_families_to_get_clo.html |title=5 ways for families to get close to birds |work=Cleveland.com |first=Martha Mueller |last=Neff |date=18 May 2011 |accessdate=22 May 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131017210413/http://www.cleveland.com/parents/index.ssf/2011/05/5_ways_for_families_to_get_clo.html |archivedate=17 October 2013 |df=dmy-all}} ===Metaphorical uses=== *The expression "[[Gnomes of Zürich]]", Swiss bankers pictured as diminutive creatures hoarding gold in subterranean vaults, was derived from a speech in 1956 by [[Harold Wilson]], and gained currency in the 1960s ([[OED]] notes the ''[[New Statesman]]'' issue of 27 November 1964 as earliest attestation). *Architect [[Earl Young (architect)|Earl Young]] built a number of stone houses in [[Charlevoix, Michigan]], that have been referred to as gnome homes. *A user of Wikipedia or any [[wiki]] who makes useful incremental edits without clamouring for attention is called a [[Wikipedia:WikiGnome|WikiGnome]].{{cite news |url=http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2006/07/31/know-it-all |title=Know It All, Can Wikipedia conquer expertise? |work=[[The New Yorker]] |first=Stacy |last=Schiff |date=31 July 2006 |accessdate=9 October 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140930011944/http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2006/07/31/know-it-all |archivedate=30 September 2014 |df=dmy-all}} ==See also== {{Commons category|Gnomes}} {{EB1911 Poster|Gnomes}} {{div col|colwidth=30em}} *[[Dwarf (mythology)|Dwarf]] *[[Dryad]] *[[Elemental]] *[[Erdgeist]] *[[Garden hermit]] *[[Gnome (Dungeons & Dragons)]] *[[Household deity]] *[[Wrocław's dwarfs]] *[[Jinn]] *[[Leprechaun]] *[[The Smurfs]] *[[Travelling gnome]] {{div col end}} ==References== {{reflist|30em}} {{Fairies}} {{Fantasy fiction}} [[Category:Deities and spirits]] [[Category:Dwarf-like creatures]] [[Category:European folklore]] [[Category:European legendary creatures]] [[Category:Fairies]] [[Category:Paracelsus]] [[Category:Supernatural legends]]

revision.text:
{{EngvarB|date=September 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2013}} {{Infobox comics meta series |character = y |character_name = Gravel |image = Gravel_Never_A_Dull_Day_cover.jpg |imagesize = |caption = Cover of ''Gravel: Never A Dull Day'' HC.
Art by [[Mike Wolfer]] |debut = ''Strange Kiss'' |alter_ego = |full_name = William Gravel |species = |homeworld = |alliances = |partners = |aliases = |powers = |schedule = |limited = y |ongoing = y |titles = ''Strange Kiss''
''Stranger Kisses''
''Strange Killings''
''Strange Killings: Body Orchard''
''Strange Killings: Strong Medicine''
''Strange Killings: Necromancer''
''Gravel'' |lang = |Horror = y |publisher = [[Avatar Press]] |startmo = November |startyr = 1999 |endmo = |endyr = present |issues = |main_char_team = William Gravel |writers = [[Warren Ellis]]
[[Mike Wolfer]] |artists = Mike Wolfer
[[Raulo Cáceres]] |pencillers = |inkers = |letterers = |colorists = |editors = |creative_team_month = |creative_team_year = |creators = [[Warren Ellis]]
[[Mike Wolfer]] |reprint = |relang = |TPB = Never a Dull Day |ISBN = 1-59291-050-5 |TPB1 = Bloody Liars |ISBN1 = 159291070X |TPB2 = The Major Seven |ISBN2 = 1592910823 |TPB3 = The Last King of England |ISBN3 = 1592910823 |subcat = Avatar Press |sort = Gravel }} '''''Gravel''''' is the name given to a series of [[Limited series (comics)|limited]] and [[ongoing series]] by [[Warren Ellis]], illustrated by [[Mike Wolfer]] and published by [[Avatar Press]]. A number of different [[Limited series (comics)|limited series]] have been published under the ''Strange Killings'' banner, all of which centred on British 'combat magician' William Gravel. Most recently these series were republished under the Gravel name, followed by the launch of a new series, ''Gravel''. ==Publication history== Gravel initially appeared in the ''Strange Kiss'' limited series, which was followed by a sequel, ''Stranger Kisses''. The third series was titled ''Strange Killings'', which remained the name for the subsequent limited series, until the latest ongoing series called ''Gravel''.[http://www.comicbookresources.com/news/newsitem.cgi?id=12375 The Minor Seven: Ellis & Wolfer talk "Gravel"], [[Comic Book Resources]], 13 November 2007 With ''Gravel'', Wolfer became the co-author with [[Raulo Cáceres]] joining as the first of what has been described as a "revolving team" of artists.[http://www.avatarpress.com/2007/10/17/gravel-artist-raulo-caceres-talks-about-ellis-wolfer-and-their-upcoming-series-with-avatar/ GRAVEL artist Raulo Caceres talks about Ellis, Wolfer, and their upcoming series with Avatar], Avatar Press ==Collected editions== The series have been collected into their own [[trade paperback (comics)|trade paperbacks]] but there is also a signed limited edition hardcover which collects the older series in one volume: *''Gravel: Never A Dull Day'' (576 pages, August 2008, {{ISBN|1-59291-050-5}}) collects: **''Strange Kiss'' (3-issue mini-series, 1999, tpb, 72 pages, 2001, {{ISBN|0-9706784-0-1}}) **''Stranger Kisses'' (3-issue mini-series, 2001, tpb, 72 pages, 2001, {{ISBN|0-9706784-4-4}}) **''Strange Killings'' (3-issue mini-series, 2002, tpb, 72 pages, 2003, {{ISBN|1-59291-000-9}}) **''Strange Killings: Body Orchard'' (6-issue mini-series, 2002–2003, tpb, 144 pages, 2003, {{ISBN|1-59291-013-0}}) **''Strange Killings: Strong Medicine'' (3-issue mini-series, 2003, tpb, 72 pages, 2004, {{ISBN|1-59291-024-6}}) **''Strange Killings: Necromancer'' (6-issue mini-series, 2004, tpb, 144 pages, 2006, {{ISBN|1-59291-033-5}}) *''Gravel'' (December 2007 – 2010, 21 issues) collected as: **''Volume 1: Bloody Liars'' (collects ''Gravel'' #0–7, 192 pages, softcover, March 2009, {{ISBN|1-59291-069-6}}, hardcover, May 2009, {{ISBN|1-59291-070-X}}) **''Volume 2: The Major Seven'' (collects ''Gravel'' #8–14, 176 pages, December 2009, softcover, {{ISBN|1-59291-081-5}}, hardcover, {{ISBN|1-59291-082-3}} **''Volume 3: The Last King Of England'' (collects ''Gravel'' #15–21, 176 pages, February 2011, softcover, {{ISBN|1-59291-081-5}}, hardcover, {{ISBN|1-59291-082-3}} *''Gravel: Combat Magician'' (4-issue mini-series, 2013-2014) == Film == A movie adaptation was planned by [[Legendary Pictures]], with [[Rick Alexander (producer)|Rick Alexander]] penciled in as producer and Warren Ellis writing the first draft as well as being executive producer.{{cite web |first=Marc |last=Graser |url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118009750.html?categoryId=13&cs=1 |title=Legendary digs 'Gravel' |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=8 October 2009 |accessdate=10 October 2009 }} Mike Wolfer was interviewed at [[NY Comic Con]] in 2010 and said his preferred actor would be [[Daniel Craig]].{{cite web |first=Tim |last=Dowd |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TfWcNlH7hzw |title=NY Comic Con 2010: Mike Wolfer Interview on Gravel |website=www.bleedingcool.com |date=13 Oct 2010 |accessdate=17 December 2013}} In early 2012 it was announced that [[Tim Miller (director)|Tim Miller]] would be directing the film while [[Oliver Butcher]] and [[Stephen Cornwell]] had been brought in to work on the script.{{cite web |first=Mike |last=Fleming |url=http://www.deadline.com/2012/03/vfx-wiz-tim-miller-digs-in-to-helm-gravel-for-legendary-pictures/ |title=VFX Wiz Tim Miller Digs in to Helm 'Gravel' For Legendary Pictures |website=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |date=15 March 2012 |accessdate=27 March 2012 }} As of June 2015, no further development on the film has been announced. ==Notes== {{Reflist}} ==References== {{refbegin}} *{{comicbookdb|type=character|id=26371|title=William Gravel}} *{{comicbookdb|type=title|id=2133|title=''Strange Kiss''}} *{{comicbookdb|type=title|id=8727|title=''Stranger Kisses''}} *{{comicbookdb|type=title|id=8728|title=''Strange Killings''}} *{{comicbookdb|type=title|id=8732|title=''Strange Killings: Body Orchard''}} *{{comicbookdb|type=title|id=8731|title=''Strange Killings: Strong Medicine'}} *{{comicbookdb|type=title|id=8730|title=''Strange Killings: Necromancer''}} *{{comicbookdb|type=title|id=16607|title=''Gravel''}} {{refend}} ==External links== * {{official website|http://www.avatarpress.com/titles/warren-ellis-gravel/}} * {{IMDb title|1528858|Gravel}} * [http://www.comicbookresources.com/news/newsitem.cgi?id=13479 "Gravel" #2 Preview], [[Comic Book Resources]], 25 March 2008 ===Interviews=== *[http://www.comicsbulletin.com/news/107542002861140.htm Mike Wolfer: Q&A], [[Comics Bulletin]], 29 January 2004 ===Reviews=== *[http://www.comicsbulletin.com/reviews/98788406536080.htm Review of ''Stranger Kisses''], [[Comics Bulletin]] *[http://www.comicsbulletin.com/reviews/120455903524326.htm Review of ''Gravel'' #1] and [http://www.comicsbulletin.com/reviews/120662824055004.htm #2] [[Comics Bulletin]] {{Warren Ellis|type=comic}} [[Category:2001 comics debuts]] [[Category:2002 comics debuts]] [[Category:2007 comics debuts]] [[Category:Occult detective fiction]]

revision.text:
{{Pie chart | thumb = right | caption = [[Religion in Romania]] as of 2011<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.indexmundi.com/romania/demographics_profile.html |title=Romania Demographics Profile 2014 |work=IndexMundi}}</ref> | other = | label1 = [[Romanian Orthodox Church|Eastern Orthodox]] (including all sub-denominations) | value1 = 81.9 | color1 = #8080ff | label2 = [[Protestantism|Protestant]] (various denominations including [[Reformed Church in Romania|Reformed]] and [[Pentecostal Union of Romania|Pentecostal]]) | value2 = 6.4 | color2 = #3fc03f | label3 = [[Roman Catholicism in Romania|Roman Catholic]] | value3 = 4.3 | color3 = #ffff80 | label4 = other (includes [[Islam in Romania|Muslim]]) | value4 = 0.9 | color4 = #9f9f9f | label5 = [[irreligion|none]] or [[atheism|atheist]] | value5 = 0.2 | color5 = #000000 | label6 = unspecified | value6 = 6.3 | color6 = }} {{bar box |float = right |title = [[Eurobarometer]] Poll 2010<ref>{{cite book|url=http://ec.europa.eu/public_opinion/archives/ebs/ebs_341_en.pdf |title=Special Eurobarometer 341 / Wave 73.1 – TNS Opinion & Social |date=October 2010 |location=Brussels |page=204 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101215001129/http://ec.europa.eu/public_opinion/archives/ebs/ebs_341_en.pdf |archivedate=2010-12-15 |df= }}</ref> |width = 200px |bars = {{bar percent|Believes in spirit or life force|#367588|7}} {{bar percent|Believes there is a god|#ADD8E6|92}} {{bar percent|Does not believe in spirit, God or life force|#90EE90|1}} }} [[Romania]] is officially designated as a [[secular state]], although there is no effective [[separation of church and state]]. Indeed, according to Law no. 142/1999, state-recognized religious denominations employees receive salaries from the state budget.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dreptonline.ro/legislatie/legea_salarizare_cler.php |title=Legea nr. 142/1999, legea privind sprijinul statului pentru salarizarea clerului |work=Drept Online}}</ref> Therefore, all Romanian citizens who pay taxes contribute to clergy salaries, regardless of their religious affiliation.
Romania is one of the most religious countries in Europe,<ref>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.ro/books?id=VxM04Jdr1NEC&pg=PA75&lpg=PA75&dq=romania+most+religious+country+in+europe&source=bl&ots=BUVc96FSEb&sig=Oh8KdMMD3saGE1YBj-7hpLS_xTo&hl=ro&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjh9_Xm9oPNAhUQsBQKHQAhA_k4ChDoAQhFMAY#v=onepage&q=romania%20most%20religious%20country%20in%20europe&f=false |title=Expanding Religion: Religious Revival in Post-communist Central and Eastern Europe |last=Tomka |first=Miklós |publisher=Walter de Gruyter |date=2011 |page=75 |isbn=9783110228151}}</ref> with 92% of people saying that they believe in God.<ref>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.ro/books?id=v_TjCQAAQBAJ&pg=PA33&lpg=PA33&dq=romania+most+religious+country+in+europe&source=bl&ots=Zkdxw8g6Eo&sig=r1C9jZbxaAsqeQ8QnEilFyBAOuQ&hl=ro&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjAx93-9oPNAhVCQBQKHVzjDVMQ6AEIXDAH#v=onepage&q=romania%20most%20religious%20country%20in%20europe&f=false |chapter=European Culture Wars: Sexual Nationalism between Euro-Christian and Euro-Secular Civil Religion in Poland and Romania |title=Religious and Sexual Nationalisms in Central and Eastern Europe: Gods, Gays and Governments |last1=Tarta |first1=Mihai |editor1-first=Srdjan |editor1-last=Sremac |editor2-first=R. Ruard |editor2-last=Ganzevoort |publisher=Brill |location=Leiden |isbn=978-90-04-29779-1 |page=33 |date=15 June 2015}}</ref> [[Irreligion]] is much lower in Romania than in most other European countries and is among the lowest in the world. At the 2011 census, only 0.11% of the population declared itself atheist, up from the 2002 census, while 0.10% do not belong to any religion.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.insse.ro/cms/files/publicatii/pliante%20statistice/08-Recensamintele%20despre%20religie_n.pdf |title=Ce ne spune recensământul din anul 2011 despre religie? |work=Institutul Național de Statistică |date=October 2013}}</ref> == Demographics == Over 20,700 people in Romania are atheists, according to 2011 census.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gandul.info/magazin/ateismul-in-romania-care-sunt-judetele-cu-cei-mai-multi-atei-11483203 |title=Ateismul în România. Care sunt județele cu cei mai mulți atei |work=Gândul |date=9 October 2013}}</ref> Thus, the number of Romanians who do not believe in God almost tripled in the previous decade.<ref name="9am">{{cite web |url=http://www.9am.ro/stiri-revista-presei/Social/236594/numarul-ateilor-s-a-triplat-in-ultimii-10-ani-dar-ne-aflam-sub-media-europeana.html |title=Numarul ATEILOR s-a triplat. Cati romani au renuntat la religie? |work=9AM |date=5 December 2012}}</ref> The highest concentration is in [[București-Ilfov (development region)|Bucharest–Ilfov area]] (nearly 8,000 atheists) and generally wealthy areas of the country ([[Transylvania]], [[Banat]]), the lowest – in [[Oltenia]] (750), [[Dobruja]] and poor areas of [[Wallachia]] ([[Teleorman County|Teleorman]], [[Călărași County|Călărași]], [[Ialomița County|Ialomița]]).<ref name="9am" /> Before the census of October 2011, Secular Humanist Association (ASUR) conducted a campaign through which tried to promote an accurate census, in which people who consider themselves atheists to have confidence in selecting this option.<ref name="9am" /> According to ASUR, European Values Survey (1999)<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.europeanvaluesstudy.eu/page/survey-1999.html |title=Survey 1999 |work=European Values Study |doi=10.4232/1.10789}}</ref> and [[World Values Survey]] (2005)<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thearda.com/Archive/Files/Descriptions/WVS2005.asp |title=World Values Survey, 2005 |work=The Association of Religion Data Archives}}</ref> polls show that the real percentage of those who declare themselves atheists is at least 6–7% of the population, 60–70 times more than the result of census in 2002.<ref name="9am" /> In ''The Cambridge Companion to Atheism'' (2006), [[Phil Zuckerman]] gives a figure of 4%.<ref>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.ro/books?id=tAeFipOVx4MC&pg=PA55&lpg=PA55&dq=atheism+in+romania&source=bl&ots=Kiw6DbpS2U&sig=K1EIjEq9NgU57P2RFwcF-GSVy2I&hl=ro&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiXlebBraXOAhVKchQKHQPaDdE4ChDoAQhLMAY#v=onepage&q=atheism%20in%20romania&f=false |chapter=Contemporary Numbers and Patterns |title=The Cambridge Companion to Atheism |author=Phil Zuckerman |publisher=Cambridge University Press |date=30 October 2006 |page=55 |isbn=9781139827393}}</ref> A 2014 poll by [[WIN/GIA|WIN/Gallup International Association]] shows that 16% of Romanians are not religious and only 1% are convinced atheists.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.wingia.com/en/services/end_of_year_survey_2014/regional_country_results/8/46/ |title=Regional & Country Results |work=WIN/Gallup International}}</ref> {{legend|#CAE1FF|>0.5%}} {{legend|#F0F8FF|0.1–0.5%}} {{legend|#F8F8FF|<0.1%}} {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Development region !! [[Irreligion|Irreligious]] !! [[Atheism|Atheists]] !! Total |- | [[București - Ilfov (development region)|București-Ilfov]] || 3,295 || 8,517 | style="background:#CAE1FF;" | 11,812 {{small|(0.51%)}} |- | [[Centru (development region)|Centru]] || 5,611 || 2,085 | style="background:#F0F8FF;" | 7,696 {{small|(0.32%)}} |- | [[Nord-Est (development region)|Nord-Est]] || 1,213 || 1,629 | style="background:#F8F8FF;" | 2,842 {{small|(0.08%)}} |- | [[Nord-Vest (development region)|Nord-Vest]] || 4,622 || 3,098 | style="background:#F0F8FF;" | 7,720 {{small|(0.29%)}} |- | [[Sud-Est (development region)|Sud-Est]] || 607 || 1,321 | style="background:#F8F8FF;" | 1,928 {{small|(0.07%)}} |- | [[Sud - Muntenia (development region)|Sud-Muntenia]] || 970 || 1,443 | style="background:#F8F8FF;" | 2,413 {{small|(0.07%)}} |- | [[Sud-Vest (development region)|Sud-Vest Oltenia]] || 380 || 525 | style="background:#F8F8FF;" | 905 {{small|(0.04%)}} |- | [[Vest (development region)|Vest]] || 2,219 || 2,125 | style="background:#F0F8FF;" | 4,344 {{small|(0.23%)}} |- | '''Total'''<ref>{{cite web |url=http://incont.stirileprotv.ro/infografice/religiile-romaniei-bucurestiul-cel-mai-mare-procent-de-atei-din-tara-judetul-unde-se-regasesc-cei-mai.html |title=Religiile Romaniei. Orasul cu cel mai mare procent de atei din tara |work=InCont.ro}}</ref> || 18,917 || 20,743 || 39,660 |} === Surveys === {| class="wikitable" |- style="text-align:center" ! Survey/Study !! Year !! Atheists !! Agnostics !! Irreligious |- style="text-align:center" | ''The Cambridge Companion to Atheism'' || 2006 | colspan="2" | 4% | |- style="text-align:center" | ''Dentsu Inc.''<ref>{{ja icon}} {{cite web |url=http://www2.ttcn.ne.jp/~honkawa/9460.html |title=Dentsu Inc.}}</ref> || 2006 || || || 2,4% |- style="text-align:center" | ''[[WIN/GIA|WIN/Gallup International]]''<ref>{{cite book |url=http://www.wingia.com/web/files/richeditor/filemanager/Romania_Tables_V3_a.pdf |chapter=Q9. Irrespective of whether you attend a place of worship or not, would you say you are? |title=Romania |publisher=WIN/GIA |date=2014 |page=10}}</ref> || 2014 || 1% || || 16% |}
=== Socio-demographic profile === [[File:Remus Cernea.jpg|thumb|150px|[[Remus Cernea]], the only avowed atheist [[Parliament of Romania|MEP]]]] According to a study conducted by researchers from the [[Open Society Foundations|Soros Foundation]], Romanian atheists are a very young group and with a significantly higher level of education that the national average: 53% of atheists are under 30 years, and 33% of them have completed higher education.<ref name="soros">{{cite web |url=http://www.ziare.com/social/romani/ateii-din-romania-sunt-tineri-educati-si-intoleranti-1127951 |title=Ateii din Romania sunt tineri, educati si intoleranti |work=Ziare.com |date=18 October 2011}}</ref> The group of [[atheism|atheists]]/[[agnosticism|agnostics]]/[[irreligion|persons without religion]] lives in a proportion of 59% in urban areas – in the capital and other major cities – and are easier to find in [[Wallachia]] and harder in [[Moldavia]].<ref name="soros" />
Atheists are more intolerant than most Romanians with regard to almost all social groups on which were questioned: [[Roma people|Roma]], [[sectarian]]s, [[Hungarians]], [[Muslim]]s, [[Jew]]s, [[poverty|poor]].<ref name="fundatia">{{cite web |url=http://www.fundatia.ro/sites/default/files/Ateu%20in%20Romania-analiza%20studiului.pdf |title=Atei în România: puțini, tineri, educați, de dreapta și intoleranți |work=Fundația Soros |author=Ovidiu Voicu |date=18 October 2011}}</ref> The only exception to this string of intolerance is represented by [[gay|homosexuals]], towards them atheists showing more tolerance than the national average.<ref name="fundatia" /> As ideological positioning, atheists declare themselves, equally, both right-wing and left-wing, most of them (56%) placing at the center of the ideological line. Only eight percent say they prefer leftist economic policies, while right-wing economic policies attract 47% of atheists.<ref name="fundatia" />
== References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.ateiagnostici.ro/ Atei și Agnostici Români (AAR)] == See also == * [[List of countries by irreligion]]
{{Religion in Romania}} {{Europe topic|Irreligion in}}

revision.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/62.6.210.170|62.6.210.170]] ([[User talk:62.6.210.170|talk]]): nonconstructive edits ([[WP:HG|HG]]) (3.4.3)
revision.text:
{{pp-pc1}} {{Redirect|Path of the jedi|Disneyland attraction|Star Wars: Path of the Jedi}} {{for|the census campaign|Jedi census phenomenon}} '''Jediism''' (or '''Jedism'''<ref name=LamontheWP>{{cite web |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/checkpoint/wp/2014/11/18/the-pentagons-pugnacious-critic-on-religion-gets-his-day-in-congress |title=The Pentagon’s Pugnacious Critic on Religion Gets his Day in Congress |last=Lamonthe |first=Dan |publisher=Washington Post |date=18 November 2014 |website=Washington Post|access-date=20 November 2015}}</ref>) is a philosophy<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-38368526|title=Jedi is not a religion, Charity Commission rules|date=2016-12-19|newspaper=BBC News|access-date=2017-02-14|language=en-GB}}</ref> mainly based on the depiction of the [[Jedi]] characters in ''[[Star Wars]]'' media.<ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=exQ4Zmtjc_sC&pg=PA59|title=Popular spiritualities: the politics of contemporary enchantment|first=Lynne|last=Hume|first2=Kathleen|last2= McPhillips|page=59|publisher=Ashgate Publishing, Ltd.|year=2006| isbn=978-0-7546-3999-2}}</ref> Jediism attracted public attention in 2001 when a number of people [[Jedi census phenomenon|recorded their religion as "Jedi" on national censuses]].
Jediism is inspired by certain elements of ''Star Wars'', namely the fictional religion of the Jedi. Early websites dedicated to bringing up a belief system from the ''Star Wars'' films were "The Jedi Religion and regulations" and "Jediism". These websites cited the Jedi code, consisting of 21 maxims, as the starting point for a "real Jedi" belief system.<ref name=findingforce>{{cite book | url=https://books.google.com/books?id=PB57P_dOF7EC&source=gbs_navlinks_s | title=Finding the Force in the Star Wars Franchise: Fans, Merchandise, and Critics | publisher=Peter Lang | author=Matthew Wilhelm Kapell|author2= John Shelton Lawrence | year=2006 | isbn=0-8204-6333-7}}</ref> The real-world Jediism movement has no founder or central structure.<ref name="D.Grant2008">{{cite book|author1=Nancy K. Grant Ph. D.|author2=Ph. D. Diana J.|author3= Mansell R. N.|title=A Guidebook to Religious and Spiritual Practices for People Who Work With People|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=eg5qZixgqbMC&pg=PA249|accessdate=16 July 2012|date=30 October 2008|publisher=iUniverse|isbn=978-0-595-50527-2|pages=249–251}}</ref>
== Beliefs == Although followers of Jediism acknowledge the influence of ''Star Wars'' on their religion, by following the moral and spiritual codes demonstrated by the fictional Jedi,<ref>{{cite book | title=Exploring religion and the sacred in a media age | last=Deacy|first=Christopher|first2= Elisabeth |last2=Arweck | page=15|url=https://books.google.com/?id=HRmYapWETqcC&pg=PA15&dq=jediism#v=onepage&q=jediism&f=false|publisher=Ashgate Publishing, Ltd.|year=2009 | isbn=978-0-7546-6527-4}}</ref> they also insist their path is different from that of the fictional characters and that Jediism does not focus on the myth and fiction found in ''Star Wars''.<ref name="KapellLawrence2006">{{cite book|author1=Matthew Kapell|author2=John Shelton Lawrence|title=Finding the Force of the Star Wars Franchise: Fans, Merchandise, & Critics|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=PB57P_dOF7EC&pg=PA106|accessdate=16 July 2012|date=1 August 2006|publisher=Peter Lang|isbn=978-0-8204-6333-9|pages=105–112}}</ref> The Jedi follow the "16 teachings" based on the presentation of the fictional Jedi, such as "Jedi are mindful of the negative emotions which lead to the Dark Side" and "Jedi are guardians of peace and justice".<ref name=about.com>{{cite web|url=http://altreligion.about.com/od/beliefsandcreeds/a/jedi_teachings.htm|accessdate=6 September 2013|title=Basic teachings of the Jedi|first=Catherine|last=Beyer|publisher=[[The New York Times Company]]|work=[[About.com]]}}</ref> Adherents also follow "21 maxims".<ref name=findingforce /><ref name=doctrine>{{cite web|url=http://www.templeofthejediorder.org/doctrine-of-the-order|accessdate=6 September 2013|title=Doctrine of the Temple of the Jedi Order|publisher=Temple of the Jedi Order}}</ref>
== Census phenomenon == {{Main article|Jedi census phenomenon}}
Jediism received press coverage following a worldwide email campaign in 2001 urging people to write "Jedi" as their answer to the religion classification question in their country's census, resulting in the [[Jedi census phenomenon]]. The majority of such respondents are assumed to have claimed the faith as a joke.<ref name="census">{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/religion/9737886/Jedi-religion-most-popular-alternative-faith.html|title='Jedi' religion most popular alternative faith|publisher=Telegraph Media Group|work=The Daily Telegraph|first=Henry|last=Taylor|date=2012-12-11|accessdate=2012-12-14|location=London}}</ref><ref name="Cusack2010">{{cite book|author=Carole M. Cusack|title=Invented Religions: Faith, Fiction, Imagination|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=EoduVhGsfp0C&pg=PA125|accessdate=4 January 2013|date=15 September 2010|publisher=Ashgate Publishing, Ltd.|isbn=978-0-7546-6780-3|page=125}}</ref><ref name="nzherald">{{Cite news|url = http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news/article.cfm?c_id=1&objectid=2352142|title = Jedi Order lures 53,000 disciples|date = August 31, 2002|accessdate = July 30, 2013|website = [[The New Zealand Herald]]|publisher = [[APN News & Media]]|last = Perrott|first = Alan}}</ref>
== Legal recognition ==
=== United States === In 2007, the Temple of the Jedi Order was registered in Texas. However [[Internal Revenue Service|IRS]] tax exemption wasn't granted until 2015. <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://library.templeofthejediorder.org/library/TotJOMaterials/TotJOIRSExemptionLetterOct15.pdf|title=IRS Determination Letter|first=|date=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
=== United Kingdom === During the drafting of the UK [[Racial and Religious Hatred Act 2006|Racial and Religious Hatred Act]], an amendment was proposed that excluded Jedi Knights from any protection, along with [[Satanist]]s and believers in [[animal sacrifice]]. The amendment was subsequently withdrawn, the proposer explaining that it was "a bit of a joke" to illustrate a point that defining religious belief in legislation is difficult.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm200506/cmstand/e/st050629/pm/50629s01.htm|accessdate=2010-02-22|title=Racial and Religious Hatred Bill|date=2005-06-29}}</ref>
In 2007,<ref>{{cite news|last1=Wells|first1=Jonathan|title=Inside the Church of Jediism: what it's like to follow The Force|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/men/thinking-man/inside-the-church-of-jediism-what-its-like-to-follow-the-force/|accessdate=7 January 2017|publisher=Telegraph|date=2015-12-15}}</ref> 23-year-old Daniel Jones founded The Church of Jediism with his brother Barney, believing that the 2001 UK census recognised Jediism as a religion, and that there were "more Jedi than Scientologists in Britain".<ref name="Cusack2010" /> In 2009, Jones was removed from a [[Tesco]] supermarket in [[Bangor, Gwynedd|Bangor]], North Wales, for refusing to remove his hood on a religious basis. The owner justified Jones's ejection by saying, "He hasn't been banned. Jedis are very welcome to shop in our stores although we would ask them to remove their hoods. [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]], [[Yoda]] and [[Luke Skywalker]] all appeared hoodless without ever going over to the [[Dark side (Star Wars)|Dark Side]] and we are only aware of [[Palpatine|the Emperor]] as one who never removed his hood."<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/sep/18/jedi-religion-tesco-hood-jones|publisher=The Guardian|title=Jedi religion founder accuses Tesco of discrimination over rules on hoods|accessdate=2011-02-22|first=Helen|last=Carter|location=London|date=18 September 2009}}</ref>
In 2010, a man who described himself as a "Star Wars follower" and "Jedi Knight" was thrown out of a [[Jobcentre Plus|Jobcentre]] in [[Southend]], [[Essex]], for refusing to remove his hood, and later received an apology. The man said that "The main reason is I want to wear my hood up, and I have got a religion which allows me to do that."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1258365/Jedi-believer-wins-apology-Jobcentre-kicked-wearing-hood.html|publisher=The Daily Mail|title=Political correctness strikes back: Jedi believer wins apology after being kicked out of Jobcentre for wearing a hood|first=Andrew|last=Levy|date=2010-03-17|accessdate=2011-02-22|location=London}}</ref>
In 2013, the [[Free Church of Scotland (post-1900)|Free Church of Scotland]] expressed concern that a proposed [[Marriage and Civil Partnership (Scotland) Bill|Marriage and Civil Partnership bill]] would "lead to Star Wars Jedi marrying couples". Patrick Day-Childs of The Church of Jediism, and Rev Michael Kitchen of Temple of the Jedi Order, both defended the right of Jedi to perform marriage ceremonies.<ref>McKenzie, Steven [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-highlands-islands-21844467 "Star chores: Do Jedi want to marry people?"], ''[[BBC News]]'', London, 20 March 2013. Retrieved on 14 June 2014.</ref><ref>Hudson, Tony [http://www.politics.co.uk/news/2013/03/25/marry-you-i-will-jedi-strike-back-against-church-on-weddings "Marry you, I will: Jedi strike back over weddings criticism"], ''Politics UK'', 25 March 2013. Retrieved on 14 June 2014.</ref>
In December 2016, the [[Charity Commission for England and Wales]] rejected an application to grant [[Charitable organization#England and Wales|charitable organization]] status to [https://www.templeofthejediorder.org/ The Temple of the Jedi Order], ruling that the group did not "promote moral or ethical improvement" for charity law purposes.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-38368526|title=Jediism not a religion, Charity Commission rules|work=[[BBC News]]|date=19 December 2016}}</ref>
=== Turkey ===
In April 2015, the students of [[Dokuz Eylül University]] in [[Turkey]] started a petition on [[Change.org]] demanding a Jedi temple be built on the campus. The petition was in response to a previous petition which had demanded a mosque on the campus of [[Istanbul Technical University]] (İTÜ). The petition demanding the mosque reached 180,000 signatures falling short of its 200,000 target and invoked a response from [[Mehmet Karaca]], the [[rector (academia)|rector]] of Istanbul Technical University (İTÜ), promising "a landmark mosque". Soon after, students from other universities started petitions demanding Jedi and Buddhist temples on their campuses.<ref name=CampusJedi>{{cite news|title=Thousands of Turkish students sign petition to build Jedi Temple on university campus|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/thousands-of-turkish-students-sign-petition-to-build-jedi-temple-on-university-campus-10161225.html|accessdate=8 April 2015|work=[[The Independent]]|date=8 April 2015}}</ref><ref name=JediTurkey>{{cite news|title=Turkish University students demand Jedi, Buddhist temples amid mosque frenzy|url=http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/turkish-university-students-demand-jedi-buddhist-temples-amid-mosque-frenzy.aspx?PageID=238&NID=80634&NewsCatID=341|accessdate=8 April 2015|work=Hurriyet Daily News|date=6 April 2015}}</ref>
== See also == * [[List of religious ideas in science fiction]] * [[Parody religion]] * [[Religious satire]]
== References == {{Reflist|30em}}
==External links== {{sisterlinks|d=Q258945|s=no|wikt=Jediism|c=category:Jediism|n=no|b=no|voy=no|v=no|q=no|m=no|mw=no|species=no}} *{{cite web |url=https://www.templeofthejediorder.org/doctrine-of-the-order |title=Doctrine of the Temple of the Jedi Order |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180317084203/https://www.templeofthejediorder.org/doctrine-of-the-order |archivedate=17 March 2018}} *{{DMOZ|Society/Religion_and_Spirituality/Fictional/Jediism/}} *[http://www.patheos.com/blogs/altmuslim/2005/06/star_wars_an_islamic_perspective/ Inspiration: Star Wars: An Islamic perspective] {{Religion topics}} {{Star Wars}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2018}} {{Use Indian English|date=November 2018}} '''Likhmidas''' (8 July 1750 – 8 September 1830) is a noted saint from [[Rajasthan]] belonging to [[Mali caste|Mali]] community. He did many miracles during his lifetime.<ref name=a>Mohanalāla Guptā. ''[https://books.google.com/books?id=CEluAAAAMAAJ Nāgaura kā rājanītika evaṃ sāṃskr̥tika itihāsa]''. Rājasthānī Granthāgāra; 2000.</ref>
He was married and had two sons and daughter and lived in [[Nagaur]].<ref name=a/> His [[ishta-devata]] was [[Ramdevji]].<ref name=a/> He has written many [[bhajan]]s and [[doha]]s, which are very popular today.<ref name=a/><ref>[http://malisamajbhilwara.com/saint-likhmidas-ji-maharaj/ Sant Likhmidas]</ref>
There are many followers of him, especially in Rajasthan. The main temple of him is located at Amarpura near Nagaur, where he took live [[samadhi]].<ref name=a/> The renovated large temple with [[pran-pratishtha]] of idol of Likhmidasji was recently inaugurated by Chief Minister of Rajasthan, [[Vasundhara Raje]] on 6 December 2016.<ref>[http://crime7.in/?p=28033 क्षत्रिय माली संस्थान नागौर द्वारा संत शिरोमणी लिखमीदास जी महाराज के नवनिर्मित मंदिर के उदघाटन]</ref><ref>[http://newsflashrajasthan.com/posts/nagaur-likmidas-living-saint-statue-to-honor-life-will-administer-state-identification-function-cm नागौर में संत लिखमीदास जी की मूर्ति का प्राण प्रतिष्ठा समारोह प्रदेश को दिलाएंगे पहचान: मुख्यमंत्री]</ref><ref>[http://www.khaskhabar.com/picture-news/news-pilgrims-colored-in-colour-of-saint-likhmidas-in-nagaur-1-134160-KKN.html संत लिखमीदास के रंग में रंगे श्रद्धालु, हुए विभिन्न आयोजन]</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}}

page.title: List of Catholic dioceses in China

revision.text:
The [[Catholic Church]] in China comprises * 21 Latin Catholic ecclesiastical provinces (including one for Taiwan), consisting of 21 Metropolitan archdioceses and 87 suffragan dioceses * 30 exempt (i.e. immediately subject to the Holy See) jurisdictions : many (pre-diocesan) apostolic prefectures and the diocese of Macau)
Furthermore, the [[Eastern Catholic]] ([[Byzantine rite]]) [[Russian Greek Catholic Church]] has an exempt Apostolic exarchate for China in Harbin.
There is an [[Apostolic Nunciature]] as papal diplomatic representation (embassy-level) to China, in Taipei, national capital of Taiwan, also charged with PRC, Hongkong and Macau.
The Catholic Church recognizes the Republic of China as the sole government for all of China; nevertheless, it does not recognize all of its territorial claims. The term “China” has to be understood as including Hong Kong, Macao, Taiwan in its 1949 provincial boundaries and Mainland China as effectively controlled by the People's Republic of China. Due to the non-recognition of the People's Republic of China, however, the authority of the Taipei-based [[Chinese Regional Bishops' Conference]] is effectively limited to the islands of Taiwan, Penghu, Kinmen and Matsu. The dioceses of Hong Kong (suffragan of Kanton) and Macao (exempt) do not belong to that conference. The dioceses of Mainland China take part in the Beijing-based Chinese Bishops Conference, which is not recognized by the Holy See.

===Ecclesiastical Province of Hangzhou=== * [[Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Hangzhou|Metropolitan Archdiocese of Hangzhou 杭州 / Hangchow]] ** [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Lishui|Diocese of Lishui 麗水]] ** [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Ningbo|Diocese of Ningbo 寧波]] ** [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Taizhou|Diocese of Taizhou 台州]] ** [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Yongjia|Diocese of Yongjia 永嘉]]
===Ecclesiastical Province of Hankou=== * [[Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Hankou|Metropolitan Archdiocese of Hankou 漢口 / Hankow]] ** [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Hanyang|Diocese of Hanyang 漢陽]] ** [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Laohekou|Diocese of Laohekou 老河口]] ** [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Puqi|Diocese of Puqi 蒲圻]] ** [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Qizhou|Diocese of Qizhou 蘄州]] ** [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Shinan|Diocese of Shinan 施南]] ** [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Wuchang|Diocese of Wuchang 武昌]] ** [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Xiangyang|Diocese of Xiangyang 襄陽]] ** [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Yichang|Diocese of Yichang 宜昌]]
